text: Draft pour at the source. The beer is a hazy pink with a white head of foam. Aroma is fruit and rart juicy citrus notes. Nicely sour. Some strawberry rhubarb notes. Medium body and medium carbonation.
honestly i dont get the fuss over this brewery. i just find their offerings mostly kinda bland.
Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshares vol. ?. Hazy orangish pour with a fluffy head. Floral notes, tart citrus, lactic, yoghurt, light kiwi, fizzy and some weak wild strawberries.

Bottle. Pours hazy bright orange with a tiny fizzy head, Aroma of kiwi, floral, cheese, strawberries, sour lactic notes, citrus and pretty funky. Taste of strawberry, cheese, kiwi, lactic tartness, stable and slight leather.
UPDATED: SEP 11, 2016 Bottle. Pours hazy milky peachy orange with a small white head. Aromas of popcorn, strawberries, lactic, citrus. Taste is sweet, strawberries, lactic, hibiscus, citrus, lemony.

From bottle. Pours a pale, murky, pinkish orange with a small, fizzy, white head. Aroma has popcorn, popcorn snacks, light sulfur, kiwi, light strawberry, lactic tartness. Taste is sour, lactic, more fruity than the aroma, kiwi, strawberry, hibiscus is also slightly noticeable here. Corny. High carbonation and a light body.

[8122-20160401] 750mL bottle. Soured fruity yeasty bread aroma has a hint of ravioli pasta thing. Hazy, orange pink body with no lasting head. Super soured fruity kiwi and melon flavour just melts away the insides of my mouth. Medium body is super, super sour. Almost as sour as the kiwi Upland brew, and fairly enjoyable. (8-/3/8/5/15) 3.9
(w/ blankboy, GregClow, jercraigs)
Overheard: "My whole tongue is a canker sore."

2016-04-01. Lightly hazy golden peach body with a small frothy head which fades quickly. Aroma of sour and funky fruit. Flavour is pretty sour and acidic, fruity melange, berry, melon and kiwi notes. Lingering sourness grabs at the throat in the finish. Average bodied palate, moderate eff carbonation. Pretty interesting, really nice, a delicious kick in the balls that is a little intense at times. 7/3/7-8/3/16-17 Bottle from Boston Wine Exchange, Boston.

[Bottle (750ml) shared with GregClow, jercraigs & mabel -- c/o j&m] Pours a hazy golden-peach with a small diminishing frothy white head. Aroma is really sour and acidic along with grain, wheat, vinegar and some fruit. Flavour is mouth-puckeringly sour and tart -- its good but its hard to drink. Medium bodied. Like I said, its good but hard to drink much of it.

Bottled 8/21/2015. 3.3% abv version. The beer is a fleshy pinkish orange color. Off white head, fairly fizzy. No bubbles after a few seconds. The aroma has a great juicy combination of strawberry and kiwi. Very little plastic as you find in a lot of strawberry sours. Mild but firm yoguty lacto flavor. Sort of a floral sweetness in the background. Some lemon and tart tangerine. Taste is tart citrus with mostly strawberries but theres also a good hit of delicate kiwi sweetness. Medium tart. Doesnt overwhelm. Quite refreshing. Light feel - a bit of body from the fruit - with sparkly carbonation. Maybe a touch of butter in the aftertaste. Very solid fruited Berliner.
Pinkish color. Nice tartness combined with a good fruity and berry flavor. Nice beer. Thanks Ernesto

Poured from bottle into a tulip: Pours pink with a tiny white head. Aroma of tart, berries, funk. Taste is very tart with some nice berry juice, a little funky, and a nice dry finish. Light to medium body, excellent Berliner.

Version à 3,3% dalcool en fût à Boston. La bière est rosée, peu mousseuse et illumine la table de son look rafraîchissant et estival! Une forte effervescence provient du fond de mon verre doù simpatiente ce liquide vif et excité. Nez dune magnifique complexité doù émanent des arômes naturels de kiwi, de fraise, de pêche, de melon, du citron, de banane... un magnifique cocktail tropical! En bouche ce liquide marqué par une belle acidité affiche également une belle effervescence et des notes sûrettes qui piquent mes joues et activent mes glandes salivaires. Les saveurs demeurent longtemps en bouche, supportées par un corps étonnement souple pour une bière à 3% dalcool. Un profond sentiment de fraîcheur en bouche avant de menvoyer une Bourbon County Rye en fût au même endroit!
Sampled at esbls. golden with just a little foam. Nice crispness and tartness here. Moderate sourness. Gentle fruit is complex. It builds as it warms. Nice.

Pours a very hazy grapefruit cocktail color with a one finger, off-white head that quickly settles into a thick, lasting ring. Streaks of soapy lacing left behind. 

Musty, funky aroma with some faint light fruit sweetness nicely integrated into the Berliner notes. Dank and sweaty with plenty of funky lactic cheesiness complimented by a subtle floral presence, some sourdough bread and sweet, slightly vinous light fruit notes. Strong musty bug/wild yeast character along with some strawberry and cream, raspberry, currant and other sweet berries. Floral notes comes on stronger as it warms. Complex with nice balance in the nose. 

Medium body with a lot of harsh acidity and slight acetone/solvent character. Very sour with lots of funky bugs, citric acidity and lactic funk along with some dry toothpick-y oak and light fruit sweetness. Hints of strawbery and cream with some cherry and other sweet berries. Well integrated sweetness and a decent amount of sourness but this beer is a bit harsh with too sting of a solvent presence for my preference.

Bottle, sent to me by b3shine (thanks Beau!). Very hazy bright orange, brisk carbonation, short lived white head. Unripened strawberries, tart/lightly sour rhubarb, nuances of green kiwi. The floral hibiscus shows up later on, as my palate adjusts to the acidity. Tart/lightly sour, quenching, and very nicely flavoured.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Highlight of the day for me. High tart quotient. Nice fruit, Kiwi adds a nice juicy complexity to the flavor. Combined with the strawberry and you have a fruity, refreshing, and nicely tart drink.

Pours deep orange into a stang. Head quickly recedes to nothing. Strawberry and hibiscus aromas. Tart with sweet strawberry and kiwi front to back. Lasting dry finish. Slight nail polish in the finish as it warms.. docking points.

75cl bottle via trade. It pours a cloudy apricot color with a minimal white head. Aroma is rich fruity and lemony, with citrus peel, hibiscus and loads of strawberries. Vibrant funk and lemon notes. Taste is acidic and clean lemony, with cherry yoghurt, strawberries, must, white wine, apricots, cranberries and light hibiscus spice. Light bodied with sparkling carbonation. Overall, delish
Pours grapefruit juice like in color with a thin to non-exist lacing. The aroma is honey, vinegar, cornmeal, strawberry and kiwi.

Enjoyed at Freetail Bottleshare 2015... Quite tart, notes of citrus, berries, funk... Nice 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2014vintage bottled on 04/23/2014!! 750 ml bottle thanks to willrunforbeer, nearly clear gold with a good amount of carbonation still left. Aroma is dusty yeast, pears, subtle lactic acid and tart hints. A very deep inhale gets me a note of flowers. 
Flavor has strawberry seeds, lime with traces of a sour kiwi finish. Pleasant tartness with very subtle sour. Very interesting and it ha held up very nicely after 16 months of age. Nice sipper.

Bottle at small tasting at home. Comparing 2 bottles. 1: bottled 23/6/14. 2: bottled 22/7/2013
1. APPEARANCE: blond beer, almost no head.
NOSE: lemon, fruity, oak. TASTE: lemon, fruity, oak, dry. => 3,9.
2. APPEARANCE: orange beer, almost no head.
NOSE: fruity, sweet, caramel. TASTE: caramel, fruity, sour, nice. => 3,9.

The 2 beers where quite different, but liked them both!
Orange pour from glass at home. 22oz bottle. It was so tart I had to pour it out. Not saying it is bad. Just not my thing. Tonite. I guess. Meh

Poured from a bottle dated 6/23/2014. 
Aroma is initially a bit poopy, but as that blows off you get a nice kiwi and strawberry character. Some light floral notes form the hibiscus. Some moderate wheat notes and a light berry character. Light citrus and moderate acidity. 
Pours a slightly hazy bright golden color with a hint of a pink hue and a small, thin white head that quickly recedes to the edges. No lacing and faint legs. 
Flavor has a moderately strong acidity with some lemon and citrus acidity. Finish has a light sweetness with a moderate strawberry and lighter kiwi note. Some medium light floral notes. Some lingering strawberry notes. 
Mouthfeel is medium light to light bodied with medium high carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a surprisingly nice beer. i dont know if the early batches had problems, but this turned out well. Nice strawberry character without any odd phenolics. Kiwi and hibiscus contribute nicely.

23.06.2014 & 22.07.2013 Vintages  2 * 750 ml. sampled @ Maldegem tasting. Thanks to Mathieu87 & PriorL. Two completely different beers. Hugely so, they even look different. 2014 one is orange / yellow with not much in the way of head. Nose is big lactic huge fruit, kiwi, exotic fruit, pineapple, hibiscus, Taste is big lactic, mandarin, orange, hibiscus, very puckering but hugely fruity as well, light strawberry, Puckering lactic body, Awesome, hugely fruity, 4.7/5. 2013 Vintage. Dark amber, little head. Nose is amber, caramel malts, light strawberry, caramel, Taste is mucky lactic caramel, puckering, light strawberry, sugar, not terribly expressive,.. Puckering caramel malt body,..; Not on par with the 2014 Version but still quite nice. 4.2/5 -> 4.45 on average. Going to going to round it to 4.5/5 on strength of the 2014 version.
On tap at Cascade. Pours a clear orange color with a medium white head. A big fruity woody nose. The flavor is robust sour fruity berry. Like 10 barrel cucumber crush. Awesome.
On tap at cascade barrel house. Pours out a hazy peach no head. Nose is peach apricot strawberries great nose. Taste is more of the peach apricot strawberries sour lots of pucker.

Bottle thanks to WillRunForBeer. About a year old. Clear amber pour with a small fizzy head that fades to nothing. Aroma is big strawberry, flowers, some light musty funk, and light kiwi. Tastes awesome. Moderate sourness, moderately tart. Tons of strawberry and kiwi (because I was looking for it), light juicy lemon, moderately acidic, some vinegar, and just a nice hint of sour funk. Medium body. Very easy to drink. Awesome.

(750ml bottle) Pours a cloudy greyish pink body with a pinkish off-white head. Aroma of vinegar, florals, and strawberries. Flavor is dominated by strawberries with raspberries, hibiscus, laco, and salt.

Shared bottle. Pours hazy yellow/gold with creamy white head. Aroma is bready malts, funk, melons, citrus, and faint spice. Flavor is funky and smooth with some tart citrus, berries, and some light oak. Light/medium body and medium carbonation.

Bottle from a trade. Nose is fruit and tropical. Very clear orange with a small white head that dies immediately. Taste is initially very sour with a mouthpuckering aspect to it. fruitiness comes through mid palate with a slight sweetness. Finish is very dry and acidic. Strawberry and kiwi come through as you continue to drink, but Im not getting any hibiscus. very good, but the sourness is clearly the focus here.

Bottle, courtesy of a kind soul... shared in a location remote of my dining room.
Pours a hazy yellow with a pinkish hue and minimal head.

The atom aid strawberry, lemon rind, floral notes, some yogurt twang and a little barnyard funk.

The flavor is tart and lemony with some strawberry and light floral bitterness. Its fruity but dry with a nice bit of sourness throughout. 

Fun, sort of weird at times... but good.
Hazy golden pour. Small white head. No lacing. Pure yogurt aroma. Taste is the same yogurtness. Not the best example. But strangely not horrible.

Bottle shared during the 4000 tasting. Poured a hazy light orange body with no head at all. Aroma is super tart, lemons, wet bread, baby aspirin. Body is acidic, sort of harsh almost, aggresive carbonation. Flavor is the same as the aroma. Good stuff.

Bottle shared by a friend. Clear gold pour with a medium white head. Aroma of malt, butter, strawberry and tartness. Sour strawberry and butter flavor with a sour fruit finish. I dont know what it is, but I detect that buttery note (thats not diacetyl) in most strawberry beers these days. Pretty interesting brew.

Bottle from unknown, received in trade. Pours a pale orange, white head that dissipates quickly. Nose lacto, strawberry, slight fruit, floral very sharp tartness. Palette soft and slightly tart, taste complex and arch taste, all elements present while still being very delicate, really nice.

[ Bottle ][ ½ of 75cl ][ Tasting ][ Trade ][ Snifter ][ 9.24.14 ]Hazy tangerine gold, puffy white head is gone quickly. Soft vanilla-kiwi nose, juicy with dough accent, honey and long. Front is high citric acid, wheaty grains and light florals through juicy mid, lightly salty with high carbonation, fruit more highlighted than acid, spritzy and lively accenting the acid, softly rounded. [ 9.24 Tasting Ranking ]01. Sante Adairius Cask Strawberry02. Russian River FfaC 201303. De Garde Imperial Raspberry Bu04. De Garde Raspberry Bu 05. Dieu du Ciel dete aux Framboise06. Night Shift Cape Codder Weisse07. Night Shift Ever Weisse08. Firestone Walker Bretta Rose 09. Crooked Stave Raspberry Dark Origins10. Almanac Dogpatch Strawberry11. Night Shift Somer Weisse12. 1809 Berliner Weisse13. De Garde Imperial Strawberry Bu14. Firestone Walker Bretta Weisse

Sampled and shared by Bacterial via 750 ml bottle. Pours a semi-clear golden straw colored brew with a fizzy off-white head that quickly dissipates and leaves no lace but a thin film top. Aroma of tart funk, light hibiscus, tart lemon zest and a touch of kiwi. Taste is medium bodied, tart funkiness flavors with hibiscus and kiwi fruit. Finish is quite tart with a lingering kiwi fruit and lemon zest aftertaste.

Pour out of 22 oz bottle, very hazy yellow-orange almost pink with thin white head, aroma brought notes of lemon, white fruit, kiwi, some strawberry, hints of very slight floral notes, hints of bready malts. Taste is a mix of nice orange, grass, kiwi, strawberry, hints of peach, lemon, slight yeast, finishing tart, dry. Pretty nice.

750ml bottle shared by Dan P. (Bottled 3/19/14) Poured a cloudy straw color with a small fizzy white head. Aroma of sour lemon, kiwi, funky brett, and wheat. Taste of tart strawberry, sour lemon, kiwi, funk, floral hops, and wheat.

750 ml bottle shared with the Quebec City crew. Pours a slightly veiled orangeish-pink with a nice white-pink head. Aroma is kiwi, strawberry, hibiscus flower, lemon. Flavor is fruit, flower, kiwi, strawberry, raspberry. Finish is very tart, some herbal touch. Lingering sourness. Medium body, soft mouthfeel, average carbonation.
#3200. Bottle. Hazy orange pour with no head. Kiwi, strawberry and nice other tart fruit aromas. Pretty fruit tart front, like Brett and other sour tones.

Bottle share: Pretty beer with a rose colored hue but after that things went downhill. Most noticeable was the big yogurt vapour and cheesy taste that when paired with the hibiscus drowns out almost all of the fruit flavors and there was not a lot of tartness to counteract. In fact the bit of fruit I did get was sweet strawberry jam that seemed out of place too. I drank a lot of great beer on this day, so having one or two bomb is not so bad. The lactic acid sour mash did not work properly... much like the failed (for almost everyone) Pipeworks Blue Lady 1st batch

Pinkish gold color with tons of carbonation but a fairly subdued white head. Lots of sour and strawberry aromas wafting up, but also some sort of synthetic aroma I cant quite put my finger on, reminds me of a hospital. More sour, more strawberries on the tongue. Also a floral note in the taste, but very distinct from the floral flavors you get from hops. Ive never tried hibiscus but I guess thats what that is. Light and fizzy mouthfeel that sort of foams up as you drink it and is amazing on a sticky summer evening. Great summer beer and another good Berliner out of Night Shift, I bought this in June or July for about $10 at the brewery.

Shared at the Batch 600 release in the Swamp Head parking lot. Pours orangish red colored with a fluffy white head. Aroma of some strawberry and floral notes, wheaty berliner and yeasty sour notes. Flavor follows with lightly tart notes and strawberry, floral flavors, wheaty berliner finish is there but subdued. Light bodied and high carbonation. Though Im not a huge fan of the style, this was pretty solid. I wouldnt turn it down if offered again. Thanks for the share!
Bottle. Pours peach gold white head. Nose and taste of kiwi, sour strawberry, sour banana, sour wheat and funk. Medium body.

Light cloudy orange with a small pale head. Aroma is sour red fruit, strawberry, hibiscus. Medium-full bodied, sour on the palate, long tart finish. Flavours are strawberries, hibiscus, cherries. Delicious
Draft at EBF, went back for multiples, my second favorite beer of the festival. Excellent rich fruitiness, nice lactic tartness, great flavors, extremely drinkable, vibrant. The real deal.

750ml bottle pours a hazy orange with some slim, white head. Nose is really interesting, smells a little pickle-y, but not in a bad way, a little bit of freeze dried strawberry, a fair amount of lime, some yogurt, some straw, a little lemon rind. Flavor has some tannic herbal tea, a little vitamin C tablet, more of that freeze dried strawberry, a bit jammy, some clementine, quite a bit of rhubarb, some lime rind, some malt, a little bit of peppercorn. Lightly tart, lightly acidic finish.
Had this at a share: pours a very light reddish color with pink head. Yeast, tartness, funk, and light fruits on the nose, with a hint of floral; follows onto the palate. Finishes tart and dry.

Thanks to Bacterial for this one. Pours pink, with pink-white frothy head. Big fruity aroma - sweet tart, peach, Hawaiian punch. Sweet up front, somewhat tart. Floral and fruity berliner. Light body, some dill, average carbonation. Quite nice.
Pinkish pour which was light and exciting for summer. The spice in flavor and the beautiful colors make it exceptionally exciting for summer.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy pink, looks good. Aroma is light tartness, hibiscus dominates fruit. Taste is light, tart, almost sweet tart, but light. Could use more sourness, otherwise very tasty .

Bottle share thanks to beechner224. Mildly hazy light reddish orange color. Fruity aroma, strawberry and big hibiscus notes. A lot f hibiscus comes through in flavor with some of the strawberry notes. Refreshing.

UPDATED: SEP 24, 2014 Pour is hazed golden amber with a tight fizzy white head.  Nose is plastic, lemon, faint grain, and a hint of strawberry.  Taste doesnt have the plastic, a bit sweet, no grain.  Strawberry, faint kiwi.  Light body, decent carb, very dry finish, a bit syrupy.
Smell is tart fruity musty. Pours clear orange. Taste is sour fruity wheat tasty. Am I I like the shots yum.! Tart drinkable berlin! Crisp. Yum.
Wonderful aroma and color. Not too sour but even and smooth finish. A great summer beer.
750 ml bottle thanks to Brian. Head fizzles big then disappears. A really nice tart aroma. Taste is big strawberry and kiwi. Slightly puckery. Delicious.

How do they do this? Beautiful light pink. Cloudy with a slight white head. Strawberry and kiwi are strong in the nose. Clean taste. Tart, refreshing. Juicy strawberry and just a hint of kiwi. Must be a ton of strawberries???
750ml bottle. Poured a hazy rubyish color with a smaller sized head. Berries, some hearbalness, fruity, and a nice lighter tart/sour finish.

Thanks to errl for sharing this bottle. Orange pour with a white head. The aroma has some heavy hibiscus and kiwi notes. The flavor is a mix of hibiscus, wheat and kiwi. There is also a nice strawberry character. Light tartness. Thin mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

Bottle... This beer rocks!... Hazy ruby pour with an orange tint and a small, fizzy, pink head. Fruity, sweet, strawberry nose with only a hint of kiwi. Light-bodied with zippy carbonation. The flavor is sour and super fruity - strawberry and lemon stand out here. Lengthy, tart, berry finish. World class wheat beer courtesy of landhoney!
Bottle..Pour is light gold with a thin head..Nose is kiwi, soured wheat, berries, funk, spice...Taste is kiwi, spice, juice, srrawberry, hibiscus. ..

Bottle thanks to Russell. Pours a cloudy pink orange with small frothy white head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is strong strawberry and hibiscus. Thin mouthfeel with strong strawberry light tartness. Easy to drink, very impressive
Light pink with a white head. Nose is funky, tart, wheat, earth, and florals. Smooth palate, acidic, tart, dried fruits, sour, great finish

Bottle... Poured pale, pinkish with a thin head. Aroma of strawberry, lemonade, kombucha-esq yeast tones. Quite nice and really refreshing. Acidity and tartness with a moderate carbonation and lively mouthfeel. Lactic acid had a strong presence but everything was balanced nicely. This was an incredibly good beer.

750ml bottle (2014 vintage) pours semi-clear pale pinkish red with small thin head. Nose is juicy strawberry, some kiwi, touches of wheat and grains as it warms, floral notes, bit of tartness. Taste is nice tart juciy strawberry, kiwi, nice balanced lacto sourness, not too acidic, cereal grain on the tail end. Finish is dry tart berry and rustic pale grains, cereal. Very nice stuff, could drink it by the gallon!
750ml bottle. Pours a pink and slight orange with an off white head. Tart strawberry lemon with a dry sour taste.
Tap. Strawberry and kiwi notes are indeed offered. Bit of a grassy lemony fruit juice. Pleasantly moderately dry. Moderate lactic sourness. Some kinda fruited soda Weiss? Drinks well enough.

Draught at the brewery, 4/10/14Lovely pour. Raspberry-red with some lighter orange/pink hues. Light haze to it, but not cloudy. Off-white, red tinged head is moderately sized but recedes quickly.Fresh strawberry juice and tart lactic and brett acids in the nose are softened on the end by wheat, very light vanilla-like sweetness and a touch of lemon-tinted sugar. With warming, tons of complexities emerge. The acid mixes with the hibiscus and wood to give an almost red wine-like note, while more lactic acid mixes with the strawberry to give a light strawberry yohgurt-like note. No alcohol or flaws. Like the jojo, I think the hibiscus is not much of an aroma-enhancer in beer. Its rather dry, nutty, earthy and just strange. But it certainly gives quite the color.The flavor is shockingly reserved on the fruit. I would never guess there was kiwi in this and even strawberry is difficult to pinpoint. Some hibiscus-like dryness/earthiness and tons of soft, well-developed lactic acid that gives plenty of tartness. Wheat leaves a soft, supple texture and the body is light and well-carbonated.I expected a lot from this one, and it delivered. What I didnt expect was much of a traditional Berliner Weisse. Thought it was going to be extremely full-on brett and tons of fruit flavor. Nope. Very light, perfectly attenuated and full of wheat and lactic acid. Higher in abv than a traditional berliner, but thats one of the few characteristics that it departs from. And you certainly dont feel the extra alcohol. Wonderful, refreshing, tart wheat beer. Just as it should be.

Bottle @ His Great Return Tasting. Thanks to Leighton (probably) for supplying this top want! Hazy gold pour with a small white head. Super tart, expressive aromas. Big strawberry and kiwi. Summer fruit salad. Apricot preserve. The taste is lovely. Light lactic acidity keeps things nimble and clean. More kiwi and strawberry jam. A bit of cake mix. Light body, active carbonation. Overall, a great effort. Nailed it.

$12 for the 750 mL bottle purchased from the source Tuesday evening. I just knew I had to have some. To oversized snifter, it pours a beauteous orange-tinted pinkish-red with which a soapy, quickly-diminishing plaque-white head 1½ fingers in length stood atop. On label, it reads: "Batch # 7. Bottled on: 7.22.13". 5.1% abv. Aromas of fruit punch, toasted coconut, plums, peach flowers, cinnamomum bark, unripe blueberries, and hibiscus tea. Tastes of everything described above with the addition of musk strawberries, kiwifruit jam, cotton, and acidulated malt. Tart, bittersweet, and refreshing. Without a doubt, my favorite Night Shift beer Ive tried thus far. Alcohol was a creeper, so be weary.

Bottle split at the Jack is back tasting, big thanks to Paulo, 06/03/14.
Hazed orange with a moderate off white covering.
Nose is tarte tangy fruit, light smoke, orange rind, bitter apricot, herbal pang.
Taste comprises apricot sherbet (if such a sherbet existed !), citric licks, straw, light sugars.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation with a lick of spritz, crisp close.
Solid stuff, super refreshing.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: UPDATED: MAR 10, 2014 6th March 2014Jack is back tasting at Bruces. Hazy gold beer, small pale cream coloured head. Palate is dry and minerally crisp. Seltzer salts and tart apricot - orange. Crispy finish. Tart but tasty.

Bottle shared in London - big thanks to Paul for this one. Pours lightly hazy gold with a creamy white head. Nice tangy berry nose, a bit of funk, some strawberries and cream. Light sweet flavor with bracing sour bite, lightly jammy berries, a bit of acetic sweat. Light-medium in body with fine, spritzy carbonation. Great depth to finish, plenty of fruity tang, juicy berries, moderate acetic bite, sweat, hints of salt. Delicious. Very drinkable.

Bottle big thanks to me. It pours hazy golden orange with a small off white head. The nose is funky, barnyards Brett, apricot yoghurt, peach, ripe fruit and wood. The taste is fresh, tart, apricot, peach, acidic, mouth-puckering tartness, wood, lemon and wood with a dry, tart finish. Medium body and fine, prickly carbonation. Intense, tart and super tasty. Crazy good.

bottle shared by tom10101, thans bro. pours hazy bright pink with a very nice pinkish head, good retention and lacing. wheaty, grassy, rhubarb and strawberries, tart unripened wild strawberries and some raspberries, light to medium acidity - mostly citric from juicy fruits, at the same time quite cheesy with an acetic touch sealing each sip. average carbonation, light body, dry and tart grassy-herbal-citrusy finish. tasty and good! excellent berliner if not a good american fruit sour..

Bottle 750ml.
Pours pink with low white head. Good lacing. Aroma is of fruits, very sour candies, rhubarb. Taste is of sour juice, fruits, sweetness, acidity, sourness. arhem. Palate: Light body. Soft/low carbonation. Overall: Very similar to sour fruit juice. Quite interesting, but I would not chug a pint. Not really drinkable.

Pours a clear red with a small white head that offers really light lacing. Nose is of berries, raspberries and strawberries is what I would have said blindly. You also get a good warning of the acid drink to come. Taste is indeed almost bracingly tart and fruity. A bit too acid for my taste (berliners should be a little more gentle), body was light and carbonation pushing toward high. Nice one, Id be curious to sample the other variations now.

Bottle (750 ml). Beautiful clear bright pink/orange with a small fully lasting off-white/pinkish head and little lacing. Aroma is very fruity with raspberries, floral notes (hibiscus?), kiwi (weird!), leafy/green presence and a nice acidic touch. Taste is also very fruity with some fruit sweetness, a nice acidic touch, raspberries, hibiscus and a leafy/green presence. Light body. Moderate carbonation. Somewhat dry finish. Very tasty Berliner Weisse and quite unique. Fruity. I liked it!

Bottle shared by John at RBWG 
Slightly cloudy pink/amber with a small pink/red head and light lacing. Aroma is tart, wheat and strawberries. Taste is tart, strawberries and super dry 
Very good, tasty
Light red pour with white head and lace. Aroma is sweet berries and acidic tones. Berries and a flat acidic flavor with a papery bitter. Medium bodied and fizzy. ok though

750 ml bottle to snifter (shared by jcwattsrugger). Looks good; a fairly transparent pinkish orange with white lacing. Smells solid; tart, fruity, and funky. Tastes like it smells with some hibiscus too. Nice and lively on the palate. A good example of the style.

750ml bottle courtesy of a trade on BA. Thanks, dude. Excited to pop the 2nd of their main Berliners. Pours a nice ruby red hue, orange and gentle haziness shows artic sunset glow, reddish orange, grapefruit color with lively carbonation, decent haze, striking glow and hues. A frothy whitish head atop stays as a decent filmy layer, good stick around and size that seems to last. Aromas are potently sour, nice hibiscus tart florals off the bat meet a distinct seedy strawberry, yogurt and tart lemony lactic life strike, covered up a bit by that hibiscus and strawberry. Gentle kiwi is more citrusy, blends in with dry straw, crakced wheat, more tart and strawberry, a bit seedy, a touch rubbery, nice sourness. Initial is firmly tart, seedy sweet and sour strawberries hit quickly, melding into a fruity and hibiscus floral tartness. Quickly more sourness, that strawberry really lasts. Earthy and tart hibiscus meet some firm lactic sourness, yogurty and lemony, some nice citric life tails into more yogurt, bready malts, some sweet jabs of fruit into the middle. The strawberry really goes in and out, offering sweet and tart. The kiwi a bit salty and more distinguishable into the middle and backend. A touch rubbery, sour and tart (but certainly not in a league with Somer Weisse), some bready malts, firm yogurty elements as we trail out, lingering lactic presence, tartness, a bit of straw and strawberry, gentle bread. Solid stuff. An assertive wonderfully sour and complex nose showing all the elements, gorgeous pour lead up to a nice front end offering some nice complexity from the additions, trailing out a bit more flat, with some acidic jabs that are nice but a bit more muted. Lacking some of the intensity I saw in Somer (but its still got some sour zip), but that likely makes it more approachable and the better more balanced of the two. Strawberry and hibiscus really work well up front, synergistic with some nice sourness into the backend that develops as we move further into the bottle. Lovely stuff. Perhaps a touch undercarbed and not as sour as Id personally like, but Id imagine that makes it a very good beer.

My Bottom Line:
Strawberry compote, kiwi and flowers whirl within this Sour Ales dry, effervescent mouthfeel.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A sheet of foam covers the hazy pale blond.
-The sourness levels are moderate enough to increase drinkability.
-This is yet another Night Shift brew which brings lots of delightful options for food pairings.
-Light rubbery phenolics are perceived in the aroma.

Bottle.
Sauce raifort, je peux presque goûter les crevettes cockail. Le côté fruité/surette est présent mais pas en avant-plan, pas vilain.
Vert tart berliner full of berry jammyness. Im missing the hibiscus in this and becomes a bit vinegar heavy at times but really nice tart berliner.
Pink, fizzy white head. Nose is tart berries, funk and herbs. Taste is tart berries, hard to distinguish the specific fruits used, some herbs. Dry and refreshing palate.

A: Hazy Ruby Red Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head Ring, Some Lacing

S: Fresh Strawberries, Hibiscus

T: Fresh Strawberries, Hibiscus, Mild Kiwi

M: Decent Carbonation, Light to Medium Bodied, Mildly Sweet, Mildly Sour

Overall, pretty solid berliner, the fruit flavors (especially the strawberry) come though individially but full flavored and fresh tasting.
Pours hazy pink with big head, aroma is tart strawberry. Taste is pretty lactic sour with a floral berry dry finish. Great beer

Glowing pinkish body, medium to thin off-white head, spotty lacing. Strawberry, kiwi, must, floral notes, wheat, and tart lemonade. Medium to light bodied, lively carbonation, assertive acidity, lingering finish.
Bottle shared by Ryan, pours hazy pink with light head. Tastes like pink lemonade. Other notes of kiwi, strawberry and tart funk. Killer Berliner.

Bottle at Erics courtesy of Ryan. Pours a pink lemonade body with thin white lacing. Aroma is tart strawberries, funk, vinegar and kiwi. Mouthfeel is tart with notes of sour fruit, sour wheat, funk, lemon, limeade and kiwi.
Aroma of nail polish remover, flavor of acetone mixed with some vinegar. Not good.
Bottle at WTWBA. Pinkish / red pour. White head. Sharp tart and sweet taste. Some citrus. Very good.

Sampled from a 0.75l bottle @ Top Hops (BA) Bottle Share. Have to say that it has a fantastic appearance this; cloudy pink/red/peach color in both body and head. A lovely raspberry aroma with tropical fruits, rhubarb, tart, kiwi and pommelo. Really fresh and refreshing in taste as well. I get tart soft grainy tropical fruits. It has a soft carbonation level and a light almost cloudy mouthfeel. Its in many ways like a juice. Really nice! Would swap this with my breakfast juice any day! 15.06.2013

Bottled. Golden coloured. Unclear. Dense beige head. ARoma: Sourness, grape and berries. Some spice notable. Flavour: Grapes, strawberries, sourness and tart. Medium bodied. Ends quite sour and grapy.

Bottle: The aroma consists of tart strawberry, light kiwi, lemon, and faint musty notes. It pours a dark hazy pinkish-orange with a small pink head that quickly fades to a thin ring. The flavor starts with with a quick dose of strawberry and kiwi. The finish has heavy sour lemon with some light vinegar. Its light bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall, its seems like a Sour Ale than a Berliner.

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2014 Bottle: Thanks, Jeff! Orange and link mixed color, opaque and muddled. Pink tinted head fades to a ring quickly. Aroma is heavy strawberry, mild lacto sourness, a faint hint of kiwi and lemon, and some sweet berry notes. Dont get much hibiscus, but its okay. Taste is sweet and tart all at once, good balance. Sweet strawberry that turns into a sharp tartness with more kiwi flavor. Also heavy lemon flesh and some sharp acidity and juiciness in the finish. Refreshing and delicious; a unique & tasty Berliner.

UPDATED: SEP 19, 2014 Bottle shared by Seth. Clear pinkish pour with a fleeting white head. Strawberry aromas. Tart but refreshing. Strawberry, kiwi, and citrus notes. Acidic, but tasty. Good body and mouthfeel.  Again on tap at the brewery.  Re-rated the score to the average of 4.1 (4.3 bottle & 3.9 draft).
(Bottle) cloudy with soapy white head. Strawberry, hibiscus, tart, lightly acetic, drinkable but vinegar takes away.

Bottle thanks Seth - Poured a nice red w/ a slight white head. The aroma was tart, fruitiness, some strawberries, and lacto. I got some strawberries in the taste and a nice tartness, but still smooth enough to make it very drinkable. It was well worth a second pour.

Sample from 75 cl. bottle. Hazy, golden colour with an amber tint. Small, white head. Tart aroma with apples, exotic fruit, lactic notes, citrus and grapefruits. Taste is sour. Medium body, lively carbonation. Finishes tart with fruits. Very enjoyable.
Bottle - Fuzzy orange pour with a small white head. Fruity floral aroma and taste of strawberry and peaches, sour and acidic on the palate with a dry finish.

Bottle at Tasting at Amager Bryghus. 
Cloudy golden coloured with a small white head.
Fruity and light acidic aroma of lactic acid and peaches.
Fruity and light acidic flavour of peaches and lactic acid.
Tart finish.
75 cL bottle. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is fruity, citric and grapefruity to peachy. Tart/citric, peachy and grapefruity. Kiwi, strawberry and hibiscus fruity mix. Tart finish.

Bottle. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. The aroma is mint, sour mash and lacto. The flavor is fruity and acidic. Strawberry and citrus. Lacto and acid. Great! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Hazy yellow with a small white head. Red grapes, sour, dry, light kiwi, red currants, lactic sour. Puckering and dry finish.

Bottle 75 cl. Pours a hazy golden with a white head. Tart, lactic aroma with a tropical fruit aroma. Light body, again very tropical fruit notes - surprisingly. Tart and astringent. More flavourful and sophisticated than a genuine german Berliner Weisse. 130913

750mL in the parking lot of Lost Abbey. Pours a full haze, glowing pink/peach. Good carbonation. Super fresh, juicy strawberry nose. Taste is the same- juicy and fresh strawberry. Lactic, fresh. Really nice.

Thanks to a chill bro for sharing this in the parking lot @ Lost Abbey. Pours a cloudy pinkish color with a white head. Really strong strawberry aroma. Some apple, lemon, and strawberry rhubarb pie. Nicely tart. Strawberry rhubarb pie on the palate. light tropical/kiwi on the nose, lemon peel, light sweetness, and a tart finish.

Bottle with a ton of thanks to Felipe! Pours clear amber pink with a medium white head that dissipates slowly leaving nice lacing. Aroma is very fruity, strawberry and other fruity notes, lemon, a bit of funk. Flavor is the same, quite fruity, obvious strawberry - probably the cleanest strawberry note i have ever gotten from a beer. Light sweet, light refreshing tartness. Light body, champagnelike carbonation. Very nice beer.

Thanks Fuj for sharing! 750ML 2013 batch

A - Ruby red grapefruit, effervescent with a nice head.

S - Lovely floral and berry aroma.

T - Über tart. Taste is slight latex and medicine sweet and tart.

M - Very dry, smooth and earthy

O - I like this and would like to have it again with some age on it.

Orange pink with a white head that dissipates quickly. Vinegar and overripe strawberries on the nose. Starts with a flowery taste, which is quickly overpowered by tart citrus vinegar with a pucker like eating a lime. A bit of kiwi fruit sweetens the finish. This is very sour and quite good.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2013 Pink, cloudy color. Bubbly, fizzy head and lace. Nose is way off: vinegar bomb & medicinal. After sitting for awhile, strawberries show up in the aroma too. Taste is a strawberry bomb with distinct notes of kiwi. Decent pucker, soft carb, quite nice despite the nose. Im a fan. 

Updating after my next bottle because this is fantastic. No vinegar or medicine, just delicious strawberries. So good.

750 at my place with group. Pours orange red. Aroma of disgusting vinegar, rotting strawberries, vomit, and mold. Taste is sour tart vinegar. Finish is medium long better than the aroma. Mouthfeel is medium.
On draft at the brewery, one of the best beers of the night, tart flavors from the kiwi perfectly balance the kiwi tartness, love it

Pours a beautiful, deep red with a pink head. Aroma of berries, funka nd sour wheat. Taste is sour, berries, sour wheat, funk and hibiscus. Tropical and citrusy. One of the most sour Berliners Ive ever had. Not necessary but fun. I like this one
Pinkish body and lacey. Very fruity with lovely sour finish.Awesome Berliner weisse by these nanobrewers, thanks Tim.

Bottle shared poured a soft pink color witj aromas of light tropical fruit, light earth, and some wheat. Flavors are light floral notes with some light fruit, soft carbonation, extremly drinkable in the heat.

On tap at Redbones
Comes to the table a light pink/amber color with an almost no existent head. The aroma is a little funky and a bit lactic with lots of strawberry dripping through my nose hairs. The flavor is lightly fruity with strawberries and hints of sour cherries poking through. Lightly sweet brown sugar and a whole lot of lactic flavor. Medium body with a moderate level of carbonation and a tart puckering mouthfeel. I typically dont enjoy a Berliner but gussied up with strawberry and kiwi and it works for me, I enjoyed this with some brisket and a vinegar sauce.

UPDATED: APR 20, 2014 750ml bottle in a bulb.  Pours pink with a lacy, off-white head.  Aroma of strawberry, kiwi, light hibiscus, sweet tarts, and a nice light maltiness.  Flavor of the fruits blends really well with the style.  Nice carbonation.  A really good beer for the style.
EDIT: This beer is awesome.  Strawberry kiwi doesnt sound like a good beer flavor, but they nailed it.  EDIT: 4/20/14 2014 Batch.  Same color with a small head.  Aroma the same with a nice sour note and a good amount of sweet fruits.  Flavor the same.  Still really like it.

oh man, this stuff was tasty .. . quite bright carbonation .. . light summer fruit, guava skin, and mild yeast .. . refreshing and upbeat, a good solid offering .. . . the polite way to talk about anal bleaching is changing your ringtone

Batch 2, bottled April 2013. Poured into Hill Farmstead stemware. Pours deep blood orange with pink hues. The beer rushing out of the bottle paints a big fizzy pink head that dissipates rather sporadically leaving almost no lacing. Aromas of juicy fresh strawberry  jam, marmalade, slight lemony acidity from what I gather is the kiwis, somewhat floral, with just a kiss of caramel malts...overall , very fresh and rich. Taste is a blast of fresh creamy fruit, nice residual sweetness without being too cloying, still super rich just like the aroma suggests. Next few sips you can start picking up on the hibiscus. Picking up some wheat grain with a medium body hiding beneath all the fruit. Medium carbonation, sits well on the palate very well unlocking the a nice malted body with almost no bitterness. The finish is very characteristic of the style, with the flavor opening up to the bready-biscuit like aftertaste. However, here is the big surprise where the kiwi tartness comes back and hugs your cheeks for the puckering factor. Killer beer that appears to be much better than batch 1. Great job from a cool new Nano. Cant wait to try their other sour style ales

2013 release. Pours a pink grapefruit juice color with a hazy body and a fizzy two fingers of foam that settles immediately. The nose is bright and tart, floral, citrus,strawberry, a touch of cherry pie funk, clove and lemon. On the palate its got a nice fruity body with round malty notes that create a nice backbone for the complex array of flavors. Follows the nose in profile and rolls nicely with balance between fruit, tart funk and cereal malt. Long quenching finish.

Bottle 750ml. corked.ABV: 5.1%. Clear medium orange yellow colour with a small to average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, fruity, light to moderate hoppy, light to moderate yeasty, riped fruit, apricot - kiwi, tart fruit. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and light to moderate acidic with a long duration, apricot - kiwi, dry. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20130111]

15-MAR-2013, bottle @Sonni, @Ulkløbben tasting, from Ølbutikken.
Clear, thin peach color. Aroma is (rose) flowers, exotic fruit, tartness.
Taste the same with sour, over ripe fruits - strawberry - and funk. Very high carbonation, thin body, tart.. A bit salty. Very fresh.
Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity sour citric strawberry aroma. Fruity sour tart citrus flavor. Has a fruity sour tart citric strawberry finish.
Bottle @ Fonefan. Clear orange body with a medium white head. Aroma is lemon, tart, fruit . Flavor is tart, fruit, wheat.
Bottle, 5.1%. Slightly hazy golden with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, wheat, fruit and lacto. Flavour is malt, wheat, lacto, sour, berries and a little acid.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Hazy amber with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, fruity, hibiscus and tart. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. 110113
Bottle @ fonefan berliner weisse, cream ale multistate tasting. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are malt, citrus, brett, grass, fruits, and hops. Nice and sour.
Bottle @ Berliner Weisse Takeover, Ulfborg 2013. Pours cloudy golden with a off white head. Exotic fruit. Herbs and flowery hops. Dry and bitter. Fruity with a mild bretty touch.

Bottle at Dunderölsprovning 2012. Hazy light orange liquid with a pink hue and small light pink head. Aroma of red berries, rhubarb, lemons, hibiscus, light lacto, apple skin and tangerines. Taste is dy and medium sour with notes of red berries, lemons and tangerines. Light to medium bodied with medium carbonation. Very balanced and refreshing. Awesome.

Bottle at Ølbutikken - shared with the Swedes. Cloudy peachy orange - white head. Ok sourish. Chlorish - swimmingpool. Light sweetness. Kiwi. Flowery hibiscus. Red berries. Rhubarb notes. Light white sugar. Nice freshness. Acid. Nice.

Pouring at the Night of the Funk.  Pours a hazed pink with a thin to medium sized white head. Soft floral and fruit notes on the nose.  Nice tartness, crisp acid.  Floral, petals, fruit.  Clean and then puckering, but still gentle.  Tart acid, bright fruit and more floral notes.  Tart and tasty.

Night of the Funk 2012. Fresh cut hay (not in a good way- vegetal and phenolic), acetic acid, grassy hoppiness, and locker room are all descriptors that describe this beer for me. Not a pleasant expirience.
Night of the Funk 2012. Pale yellow color. Aroma of subtle feet and straw. Taste is rather more on the acetic side, with little fruit evident.
